Module project.chenlin_17
Package project.chenlin_17.Views

Class Brick

java.lang.Object
project.chenlin_17.Views.Brick
Direct Known Subclasses:
CementBrick, ClayBrick, SteelBrick
abstract class Brick extends Object
This is the abstract base class for all brick classes which defines the common attributes and behaviors of all brick classes.

The layout of the view of the brick contains model of the brick and adds the view of the brick into container, the brick could be displayed onto the stage. Note: It contains changes from the awt to javafx.
It contains changes of class variables according to Bob's code convention. Deleted: crack variable, since some type of the brick doesn't have crack

Version:
Version1.0
update: December 29th
Author:
Lin CHEN - modified

  • Constructor Details

    • Brick

      private Brick(javafx.geometry.Point2D pos, javafx.geometry.Dimension2D size, int strength)
      This constructor helps build basic settings for the brick. It is a helper constructor for color and image brick settings. 
       
  Modified from the original source code:
  public Brick(String name, Point pos,Dimension size,Color border,
  Color inner,int strength){
      rnd = new Random();
      broken = false;
      this.name = name;
      brickFace = makeBrickFace(pos,size);
      this.border = border;
      this.inner = inner;
      this.fullStrength = this.strength = strength;
  }
      Parameters:
      pos - brick's position
      size - brick's size
      strength - brick's strength

    • Brick

      public Brick(javafx.geometry.Point2D pos, javafx.geometry.Dimension2D size, javafx.scene.image.Image image, int strength)
      This constructor helps build general brick view with image. 
       
  Modified from the original source code:
  public Brick(String name, Point pos,Dimension size,Color border,
  Color inner,int strength){
      rnd = new Random();
      broken = false;
      this.name = name;
      brickFace = makeBrickFace(pos,size);
      this.border = border;
      this.inner = inner;
      this.fullStrength = this.strength = strength;
  }
      Modified: Point->Point2D
      Dimension -> Dimension2D
      Parameters:
      pos - brick's position
      size - brick's size
      strength - brick's strength
      image - brick's associated image

    • repair

      public abstract void repair()
      This function helps repair the brick for replaying purpose. 
       
   Modified from the original source code:
   public void repair() {
      broken = false;
      strength = fullStrength;
   }

    • impact

      public void impact()
      This function sets the impact of the ball hitting the ball.
      After impact, the current strength of the brick should minus itself by one and if the current strength drops to 0, sets the broken status of the brick to true (broken). 
       
  Modified from the original source code:
  public void impact(){
      strength--;
      broken = (strength == 0);
  }
